solution_line_template: The total number of apples delivered was: {apples_per_crate} apples x {num_crates} crates = <<{apples_per_crate}*{num_crates}={total_apples_delivered}>>{total_apples_delivered} apples

So, the number of remaining apples after throwing away the rotten ones was: {total_apples_delivered} apples - {rotten_apples} apples = <<{total_apples_delivered}-{rotten_apples}={remaining_apples}>>{remaining_apples} apples

And now, we can find the total number of boxes of apples by dividing the remaining number of apples by the number of apples per box: {remaining_apples} apples / {apples_per_box} apples/box = <<{remaining_apples}/{apples_per_box}={total_boxes}>>{total_boxes} boxes of apples.
